text: Louis Carl "Lou" DobbsEncyclopedia of Populism in America: A Historical Encyclopedia, eds. Alexandra Kindell; Elizabeth S. Demers (Santa Barbara, CA: ABC-CLIO, 2014), p. 186 (September 24, 1945 - July 18, 2024) was an American television journalist, business writer and news anchor. He was the host of the program Lou Dobbs Tonight on the Fox Business Network. The show was cancelled in February 2021. Dobbs was born in Childress County, Texas. He was raised in Rupert, Idaho. Dobbs studied at Harvard University. Before Fox, Dobbs was an anchor, managing editor, an executive vice president at CNN. He won an Emmy, a Peabody Award and a Luminary Award (from the Business Journalism Review). Many personalities have accused him of racism mainly against Latin Americans, or Hispanic. Dobbs died on July 18, 2024 in West Palm Beach, Florida at the age of 78. == References == Category:1945 births Category:2024 deaths Category:American television news anchors Category:Journalists from Texas Category:CNN people Category:Fox News people Category:American Emmy Award winners Category:Peabody Award winners Category:Businesspeople from Idaho Category:Businesspeople from Texas Category:American television producers Category:Writers from Idaho Category:Writers from Texas Category:American political commentators
